explanation: Agent A is correct in the scenario described. Rule 14.3 forbids invariant controlling expressions; an if whose controlling expression is a compile-time constant (for example if the macro MHD_D_IS_USING_THREAD_PER_CONN_(daemon) expands to 0 or 1 regardless of the runtime daemon argument) is an invariant controlling expression and therefore breaches 14.3. The listed exceptions (infinite loops, the specific do-while case) do not apply to these if statements. Note: if in the actual codebase the macro is defined so that it depends on daemon at runtime (i.e. it is not a compile-time constant), then there is no violation. But given the configuration scenario Agent A described (macro expanding to a constant), the report of a 14.3 violation is correct.
